result.execSummary:
The defendant Terry J Searvogel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(>3-10g) [Modifiers: Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a Park], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)2.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant shall not possess any illegal drugs or substances/drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961.
Defendant shall possess prescription medications only by valid prescription, and take in the manner and method as prescribed by a physician.

Bond Terminated Slip
c: WC Jail

Defendant Terry J Searvogel in court, in custody.  Attorney Nicholas William Bolz in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Alex Gelhar in court for Terry J Searvogel. 
Hrg. on all cases 19CF231, 22CF57, 22CF158.
22CF158 - Stmt. Atty. Gelhar - Complaint rec'vd; waives reading
Waives PH; PH waiver filed with the court
Rights explained
Court finds the def. is waiving his right to a PH; finds probable cause/bind def. over to Br. III Argn.
Atty. Gelhar ackn. receipt of Information matches complaint.
Stmt. ADA Information filed is consistent with complaint.
22CF158 Ct. 1 Def. plea NC
22CF57 Ct. 3 Def. plea NC
Plea questionnaire/waiver filed with the Court.
Def. informed of his rights.
Court finds def. is waiving his rights.
Court finds def. guilty Ct. 1 22CF158 and orders Ct. 2 to be dismissed and read in
Court finds def. guilty Ct. 3 22cf57 and orders Ct. 1,2,4 & 5 to be dismissed and read in
State is in compliance with victim notification.
Stmt. by ADA and Atty. Gelhar sentencing.
Court orders on 18CF380  Ct. 1  sentencing hearing revocation - time served and civil judgment for unpaid costs/fees $578.00
Court orders on 19CF231 Ct. 2 & Ct. 3 sentencing hearing revocation - time served and civil judgment for unpaid costs/fees $1,036.00
Court orders on 22CF57 Ct. 3 defendant to pay the costs of the action
Court orders on 22CF158 Ct. 1; 6 years with initial confinement of 3 years and 3 years of extended supervision; court directed that the def. is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program.  Conditions of Ext. supervision - Pay costs of the action with any supervision fees; Defendant shall not possess any illegal drugs or substances/drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961. Defendant shall possess prescription medications only by valid prescription, and take in the manner and method as prescribed by a physician. 
Def informed by the Court of Post conviction, firearms and voting restrictions.

Defendant appeared , in custody, via Zoom. 
Atty Drury appeared via Zoom.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 31, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Terry J Searvogel appeared via zoom, in custody.  ADA Danuta Kurczewski in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty. Kate Drury appeared via zoom on behalf of defendant.
Per Atty. Drury - not sure if Mr. Searvogel qualifies for SPD appt., has not met with him yet - making special appearance today.
Complaint received, reading waived.
Statements by ADA Kurczewski re: bond.
Statements by Atty. Drury re: bond.
Court orders 2000.00 signature bond - see bond for conditions.
Court continues matter until 5-31-2022 @ 11:30 AM - AIA w/1970
